result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Arlene R. Erickson

records.addlTxt: Sentencing hearing on November 11, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

2:40 PM cases 21CF1103, 21CF1395, 22CF611 called. Prosecuting Attorney Peter J. Rindal in court for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Zebulon Patek in court for Arlene R. Erickson. Defendant Arlene R. Erickson appeared by video from Taycheedah Correctional. Agreement has been reached. Attorney Patek requests a breakout room with Defendant. 

2:44 PM Off the record
2:50 PM Back on the record

Defendant waives right to appear in person. State recites agreement and requests PSI. Defendant acknowledges prior convictions. Defendant is advised of charges, maximum penalties, elements of the crime(s) and constitutional rights. 

21CF1395: Defendant pleads Guilty to Count 1: Delivery of Methamphetamine Second or Subsequent Offense without repeater and Count 2: Maintain Drug Trafficking Place Second or Subsequent Offense without repeater.

Court accepts the pleas and finds the defendant guilty. 

Remaining charges are dismissed and read in including 21cf1103 and 22CF611.
State in compliance with victim notification requirements. 

Court orders Presentence Investigation.

Sentencing Hearing set for 11/11/2022 at 2:30 PM (1 hour)

Cases called at 10:45 AM: 21CF1103, 21CF1395, 22CF611. Hearing held via Zoom and in person.
Defendant Arlene R. Erickson does not appear.  Attorney Zebulon Patek in court for Arlene R. Erickson. District Attorney Peter Rindal in court for State of Wisconsin.  
Attorney Patek notes the Defendant is in custody at Taycheedah Correctional. Clerk indicates that Taycheedah is having issues connecting to the Zoom Hearing.
ARGN rescheduled to 8/25/22 at 2:30 PM.

(2:04 PM cases 21CF1103, 21CF1395, 22CF611 called.) Prosecuting District Attorney Peter J. Rindal in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Arlene R. Erickson in court, in custody. Attorney Zebulon Patek in court for Arlene R. Erickson.
Defendant waives right to a preliminary hearing in cases 21CF1103, 21CF1395, 22CF611 and Court accepts waivers.
Attorney Patek to schedule an Arraignment in each case with the Branch 2 Judicial Assistant.

9:32 AM (Cases called 21CF1395, 21CF1103, 22CF611)
Prosecuting attorney Andrew James Gunderson in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Arlene R. Erickson in court, in custody with Attorney Zebulon Patek.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 2, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Preliminary hearing on August 2, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt:
ADDRESS INFO for Arlene R. Erickson
Current: 1971 16 1/2 Ave Lot 31, Cameron, WI 54822 United States  (Effective: 06-06-2022)
Prior: Homeless, Eau Claire, WI 54701

Conditions:
No contact with anyone involved in illegal drug activities, except in a therapeutic setting. 
Defendant to maintain absolute sobriety. 
Defendant not to consume/possess any alcohol or go into any taverns, bars, liquor stores/place where alcohol is primarily served/sold. 
Defendant not to consume/use/possess any illegal drugs/non-prescribed medications/controlled substances or drug paraphernalia. 
Comply with Pre-Trial Monitoring Services with possible testing based on monitoring level. 
(covers 21CF1103, 21CF1395, 22CF611)

(11:19 AM cases 21CF1103, 21CF1395, 22CF611 called.) Prosecuting attorney Matthew Z Kirkpatrick in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Arlene R. Erickson appeared by video, in custody in the Eau Claire County Jail. Attorney Katherine Cook appeared by video for Arlene R. Erickson.
Defendant waives formal reading of the complaints and time limits for preliminary hearings in 21CF1392, 22CF611.
Court orders the warrants are quashed.
State requests $5,000.00 cash bond to cover 21cf1395, 22CF611 and cites reasoning. Attorney Cook requests signature bond as the defendant is on probation.
Court orders $5,000.00 cash bond with conditions to cover all 3 cases.
Defendant updates address and phone number with the Court.
Settlement Conference (by phone) with District Attorney's Office (715-839-4828) on June 27, 2022 at 2:15 pm.
Hearing scheduled for July 18, 2022 at 09:30 am.
